DOOM+Left 4 Dead+Splatter House=Killing Floor.
This game is totally worth it!

One of the best zombie co-op survival games i've ever played. It is possible to play it solo, but for the higher difficulties, you will definitely need some help. It's very challenging and has some great achievments. It's fun to play, just don't play it too much because you will get angry really easily ;)
Definitely recommend, it's a ton of fun and has endless replay value.

Shoot shit in the face. Thats always fun.

The core of the game is really repetitive with slow moving dumb monsters (AI, what's that?) and little strategy.  Mostly it's shoot monsters to get money, buy more weapons and shoot more monsters.   The graphical engine is also dated.  How anyone can compare this to Left for Dead is beyond me.

It's not a game I could see playng all the time.   I've owned it for a couple years and mostly I still pull it out for the Christmas and Halloween special events.  Shooting Cookie Monsters in Santa's twisted workshop is fun.   As a first person shooter, it really reminds me of those crazy maps from Half Life Death Match but in this case you're shooting slow moving monsters instead of other players.

But hey, plenty of us have spent a lot of time playing a repetitive game like Half Life death match.  If you're ok with that- go for it.

It's worth buying on a good sale.  The developers have good ideas, they're just using a hopelessly dated game system.   I just wish people would stop comparing it to Left for Dead 2, a far superior game.

I tried to ride the fly wheel on the map "Steamworld" for 6 hours. When I finally reached the carts, they were invisible nonexistant fuck squares. The developers of Killing Floor are lazy pieces of fucking trash. Any game in 2014 or whenever this game was released that does not have an intact flywheel is garbage malware. It's not the fly wheel, it's the lie wheel, and tbh killing floor has made me feel feelings of chronic depression. I'm fucking done. All I wanted to do is ride my fucking fly wheel but there was no fly, not even a wheel. I instantly uninstalled this malware garbage off of this computer and attemted suicide via electrical. I cannot believe this excuse for a game exists in todays modern market. A non-existant fly wheel is an insult and a spit in the face of gamers and this garbage cannot be tolerated. I had previously given this game a positive review, but after the lie wheel digitally raped my gamer rights, I have opted to give this game a negative review and end my own life. Some people say that suicide is a direct path to hell, and if I go to hell I know exactly what I will find waiting and it will be this game. Fuck Tripwire and their disgraceful wheel of lies. I'm fucking done.

Overrated.  Not a bad game, just out dated,  There are lots of good zombie experiences out there.  This is not the best one.  Lots of cool mods for this game though, + Steam Workshop. 

One extremely positive note - I love the fact that you can still ADS when you are dual wielding.  It feels good too, it seems like a pretty polished mechanic.

 Worth the buy only if its on sale.

One of the best co-op games out there.

You'll either love it or hate it. And once your first impressions of the voice acting are dealt with you find what is in my experience one of the best co-op survival games out there.

Map design has come a long way with developers skills at making levels getting so much better with every new map pack, all of which are free.

Get this game now.

A great game for all FPP / zombie shooter fans. Fantastic gameplay as far as multiplayer and atmosphere while killing bosses with your teammates. Can't believe I did not know this game when it went out on the market.

World's Best  Z.E.D Co-op Survival Horror FPS game ever

Killing Floor's a great CO-OP horror game, where you and your teammates get attacked by hordes of zombies and you have to survive, defend and support your teammates with money if they need it. I got it with most of the DLCs in Tripwire's HumbleBundle along with other games, and I've been enjoying this game ever since. It has a nice collection of weapons and characters to choose from depending on your preference and playstyle. The DLCs are worth buying, especially if you love and enjoy this game.

A must have for any FPS gamer that likes shooting and sliciing zombies into shreds!

10/10
